net.proteusframework.core.hibernate.dao

Class DAOHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.core.hibernate.dao.DAOHelper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean

    public abstract class DAOHelper
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean
    Helper implementation for CRUD based DAOs.
    Author:
    Russ Tennant (ken@i2rd.com)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  DAOHelper.AfterTransactionCallback
      Called after a Transaction completed.
      static interface  DAOHelper.BeforeTransactionCallback
      Called before a transaction is started.
      static class  DAOHelper.DAOEntityStateValidationException
      Exception generated when DAO validation for checking the contracted entity states is violated.
      static interface  DAOHelper.ResultTransactionCallback<R>
      Transaction callback with a return value.
      protected static class  DAOHelper.ResultTransactionCallbackImpl<R>
      Helper implementation for use with the transaction callback interfaces.
      static interface  DAOHelper.TransactionCallback
      Transaction callback.
      static interface  DAOHelper.VoidTransactionCallback
      Transaction callback with a void return type.
      protected static class  DAOHelper.VoidTransactionCallbackImpl
      Helper implementation for use with the transaction callback interfaces.

      • beginTransaction

        protected void beginTransaction(FlushMode mode)
        Begin a transaction.
        Parameters:
        mode - the flush mode.
        See Also:
        HibernateSessionHelper#beginTransaction(FlushMode)

      • commitTransaction

        protected void commitTransaction()
        Commit transaction. If the beginTransaction() has been called multiple times since the last rollback or commit, then this method will do nothing. The last commitTransaction() will commit the transaction.

      • consume

      • doInTransaction

        protected <R> R doInTransaction(DAOHelper.ResultTransactionCallback<R> callback)
        Execute the specified callback in a transaction. On failure recoverableRollbackTransaction() is called.
        Type Parameters:
        R - the result type.
        Parameters:
        callback - the block of statements to execute.
        Returns:
        the result return by the callback.

      • doInTransaction

        protected <R> R doInTransaction(DAOHelper.ResultTransactionCallback<R> execute,
                                DAOHelper.BeforeTransactionCallback beforeTransaction,
                                DAOHelper.AfterTransactionCallback afterTransaction,
                                HandleExceptionCallback handleException)
        Execute the specified callback in a transaction. On failure recoverableRollbackTransaction() is called.
        Type Parameters:
        R - the result type.
        Parameters:
        execute - the block of statements to execute.
        beforeTransaction - statements to execute before the transaction starts.
        afterTransaction - statements to execute after the transaction completes.
        handleException - statements to execute when an exception is thrown.
        Returns:
        the result return by the callback.

        Parameters:

        beforeTransaction - statements to execute before the transaction starts.
        afterTransaction - statements to execute after the transaction completes.
        handleException - statements to execute when an exception is thrown.

      • doReturningWork

        public <R> R doReturningWork(ReturningWork<R> work)
        Controller for allowing users to perform JDBC related work using the Connection managed by this Session. After execution returns the result of the ReturningWork.execute(java.sql.Connection) call.
        Type Parameters:
        R - The type of the result returned from the work
        Parameters:
        work - The work to be performed.
        Returns:
        the result from calling ReturningWork.execute(java.sql.Connection).
        Throws:
        HibernateException - Generally indicates wrapped SQLException
        See Also:
        Session.doReturningWork(ReturningWork)

      • doWork

        public void doWork(Work work)
        Controller for allowing users to perform JDBC related work using the Connection managed by this Session.
        Parameters:
        work - The work to be performed.
        Throws:
        HibernateException - Generally indicates wrapped SQLException
        See Also:
        Session.doWork(Work)

      • flushAndClearSession

        public void flushAndClearSession()
        Flush and clear the session. This flushes hibernate's action queue and evicts all items from the 2nd level cache.

      • flushSession

        public void flushSession()
        Flush the session, including hibernate's action queue.

      • recoverableRollbackTransaction

        protected void recoverableRollbackTransaction()
        Rollback the transaction (and the cause is not a hibernate exception so its recoverable)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if not in a transaction.
        See Also:
        HibernateSessionHelper#recoverableRollbackTransaction()

      • rollbackTransaction

        protected void rollbackTransaction()
        Rollback the transaction.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if not in a transaction.
        See Also:
        HibernateSessionHelper#rollbackTransaction()

      • setNestTransactions

        public void setNestTransactions(boolean nestTransactions)
        Sets flag for doing nested transactions. Defaults to true.
        Parameters:
        nestTransactions - the nest transactions flag.

      • setSessionHelper

        public void setSessionHelper(HibernateSessionHelper sessionHelper)
        Set the hibernate session helper.
        Parameters:
        sessionHelper - the Hibernate session helper.

      • validatePersistentEntityState

        protected void validatePersistentEntityState(java.io.Serializable entity,
                                             java.lang.String entityParamName)
                                      throws DAOHelper.DAOEntityStateValidationException
        Validate that the provided hibernate entity is persistent.
        Parameters:
        entity - The entity.
        entityParamName - The name of the entity that will be used in exception message. Optional.
        Throws:
        DAOHelper.DAOEntityStateValidationException - If the entity is not persistent. This can include if the entity is null.
